title: [PyTorch] Infinity norm gives 1
body_html:
Both torch.renorm and torch.norm always computes infinity norm as 1 because they actually computes norm = (\sum_i x_i^p)^(1/p)` as `\infty^0 = 1.

relevant post: https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/weird-behavior-in-torch-renorm-for-l-infinity-norms/16731

body:
Both `torch.renorm` and `torch.norm` always computes infinity norm as `1` because they actually computes ``norm = (\sum_i x_i^p)^(1/p)` as `\infty^0 = 1``.

relevant post: https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/weird-behavior-in-torch-renorm-for-l-infinity-norms/16731
